5 Housing if adjacent to a River, Lake, or Oasis. 3 Housing if adjacent to a Coast. 2 Housing otherwise. Aircraft Capacity: 1 Tile is always worked for free. Yields are at least 2 Food and 1 Production.

Science-oriented District. Adds points towards Great Scientist. +1 Science from each adjacent Mountain. +1 Science from every 2 adjacent Rainforest and district tiles. +2 Science from each adjacent Reef tile. +2 Science from each adjacent Geothermal Fissure tile.

Culture-oriented District. Adds points towards Great Writer, Great Artist and Great Musician. +2 Culture from each adjacent wonder. +1 Culture from every 2 adjacent district tiles. +2 Culture from each adjacent Entertainment Complex and Water Park tile. Buildings contain Great Work slots.

Faith-oriented District. Adds points towards Great Prophet. +2 Faith from each adjacent natural wonder. +1 Faith from each adjacent Mountain. +1 Faith from every 2 adjacent Woods and district tiles. Allows Purchasing with Faith of Religious Units.
Military District. Adds points towards Great General. Has a defense value and can fight as the City Center. Produced military units appear here. Cannot be built next to the City Center.

Commerce-oriented District. Adds points towards Great Merchant. +2 Gold from each adjacent river and Harbor. +1 Gold from every 2 adjacent district tiles. +1 Trade Route capacity if the city does not have a Harbor.

Seafaring District. Adds points towards Great Admiral. +1 Gold from each adjacent coastal resource. +1 Gold from every 2 adjacent district tiles. +2 Gold from adjacent City Center. +1 Trade Route capacity if the city does not have a Commercial Hub. Must be built on Coast or Lakes Terrain adjacent to land. Produced ships will appear here. Landlocked cities with this District may produce ships. Removes the Movement penalty for embarking and disembarking to and from this tile.

Production-oriented District. Adds points towards Great Engineer. +1 Production from each adjacent Quarry. +1 Production from each adjacent Mine. +1 Production from every 2 adjacent district tiles. +1 Production from each adjacent strategic resource. +1 Production from every 2 adjacent Mine or Lumber Mill. +2 Production from every Aqueduct, Bath, Canal or Dam. Some District buildings' bonuses extend to each city within 6 tiles.
Amenity-boosting district. Mutually exclusive with Water Park. +1 Amenity Some District buildings' bonuses extend to each city within 6 tiles.

Housing from water is increased by 2 or set to 6, whichever is higher. Must be built adjacent to both the City Center and one of the following: River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain. Ignores the normal population requirements for district construction.

Gives Housing based on tile's Appeal: Breathtaking: +6 Charming: +5 (The Mbanza provides this much Housing regardless of Appeal.) Average: +4 Uninviting: +3 Disgusting: +2 Ignores the normal population requirements for district construction. Any number of Neighborhood or Mbanza districts may be built in a city.
Aircraft-building District (only cities with this District may built aircraft). Cannot be built on Hills. Aircraft Capacity: +4 (+4 more with Buildings) Aircraft Capacity: +2 (+2 more with Buildings)
Enables projects leading to the Science Victory. Cannot be built on Hills. Ignores the normal population requirements for district construction.

Diplomacy and espionage-oriented District. May only be built once per civilization. +1 Culture (+1 Diplomatic Favor) from each Delegation or Embassy from a foreign civilization through diplomacy. +1 Envoy when built next to the City Center. Enemy Spies operate at 2 levels below normal when targeting this district or adjacent districts.
Capital receives +1 boost to all yields. 10% Bonus to wonder production. +10% Production toward Wonders.
nodes.Legacy Bonus: Additional +1% Bonus to wonder production every 20 turns.

nodes.Effects: All cities with a district receive +1 Amenity. 15% Bonus to Great People point generation. +15% Great Person points.
nodes.Legacy Bonus: Additional +1% Bonus to Great People point generation every 15 turns.

nodes.Effects: +2 Housing in any city with medieval walls. 20% Bonus influence points. +50% Influence Points.
nodes.Legacy Bonus: Additional +1% Bonus influence points every 10 turns.

nodes.Effects: Can buy land combat units with Faith. All units gain +5 Religious Strength in theological combat. 15% Discount on faith purchases. 15% Discount on Purchases with Faith.
nodes.Legacy Bonus: Additional +1% Discount on Faith purchases every 15 turns.

nodes.Effects: Land units gain +4 Defense Strength. Industrial Zone districts can defend. 10% bonus on all Production. +15% Production. +10% Science.
nodes.Legacy Bonus: Additional +1% bonus on all Production every 20 turns.

nodes.Effects: Patronage of Great People costs 50% less Gold. 30% bonus yields from district projects. 25% Discount on Purchases with Gold. 15% Discount on Purchases with Gold.

nodes.Notes: Modern era counter to cavalry class units.
Atomic era naval unit that can transport 2 air units.
Atomic era anti-air support unit. Provides cover from air and nuclear attacks up to 1 tile away from the weapon.
Find and extract Artifacts from Antiquity Sites to be displayed in their home city's Museum.
First Ancient era ranged unit with Range of 2.
Modern era bombard unit, ideal for attacking cities. Cannot move and attack on the same turn unless they've earned the Expert Crew promotion.
Ancient era support unit. When adjacent to a city , attacking melee units do full damage to the city's walls.
Modern era naval ranged unit. Provides cover from air and nuclear attacks up to 1 tile away.
Norwegian unique Medieval era unit. 4 Movement if this unit starts in enemy territory. +10 Combat Strength when attacking and -5 Combat Strength when defending.
First air combat unit, available in the Modern era.
Renaissance era bombard unit, ideal for attacking cities. Cannot move and attack on the same turn unless they've earned the Expert Crew promotion.
First bomber unit, available in the Atomic era.
May create tile improvements or remove features like Woods or Rainforest. Build charges number can be increased through policies or wonders like the Pyramids.
Fast Renaissance era exploration melee naval unit.
Classical era bombard unit, ideal for attacking cities. Cannot move and attack on the same turn unless they've earned the Expert Crew promotion.
Fast-moving Industrial era light cavalry unit.

Spanish unique Renaissance era unit that replaces the Musketman. +10 Combat Strength when there is a Missionary , Inquisitor , Apostle or Guru in the same hex. If this unit captures a city or is adjacent to a city when it is captured, the city will be converted to Spain's majority Religion.

Russian unique Industrial era unit that replaces Cavalry. Stronger than Cavalry, and gains +5 Combat Strength when fighting in or adjacent to its home territory. Can move after attacking if Movement points remain.
Medieval era ranged unit.
Chinese unique Medieval era unit. Ranged unit with a Range of 1 and high combat strength.
Strongest melee naval unit. Reveals Naval Raiders within sight range.
Australian unique Modern era unit that replaces Infantry. +10 Combat Strength when fighting on Coastal tiles. +5 Combat Strength when fighting on Neutral or Foreign Territory.
Khmer unique Medieval era siege unit. Can move and shoot in the same turn and exerts zone of control.
Byzantine unique Classical Era unit that replaces the Quadrireme that has additional range and receives +10 Ranged Strength against units.
Aztec unique Ancient era unit that replaces the Warrior. Has a chance to capture other civilizations' military units by turning them into Builders.
Industrial era ranged unit.
Atomic era Biplane upgrade.
Renaissance era ranged naval unit.

Gallic unique Ancient Era unit that replaces the Warrior. More expensive but receives +10 Combat Strength when fighting units with a higher base Combat Strength. +5 Combat Strength vs. district defenses.
Ancient era melee naval combat unit. Can only operate on coastal waters until Cartography is researched.
French unique Industrial era melee unit. +10 Combat Strength when fighting on your capital's continent. Great General points for killing units.
Gains 1 bonus Movement if it begins a turn on a flat tile with no Woods , Rainforest , or Hills.
Fast-moving Atomic era light cavalry unit.

Macedonian unique heavy cavalry unit that replaces the Horseman. Additional +5 Combat Strength when adjacent to a Great General. +5 Great General points when killing an enemy unit. Starts with 1 free Promotion.
Greek unique Ancient era unit that replaces the Spearman. +10 Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent Hoplite unit.
Fast-moving Classical era light cavalry unit.
Mayan unique Ancient Era ranged unit that replaces the Archer. Strong ranged attack. +5 Ranged Strength when fighting a wounded opponent.
Macedonian unique melee unit that replaces the Swordsman. +5 Combat Strength when besieging Districts. 50% Additional Support Bonus.
Persian unique melee unit that replaces the Swordsman. Melee class unit with a ranged attack, Range 2. Strong defense strength.
Modern era melee unit.
Powerful Industrial era armored melee naval unit.
Information era Bomber upgrade.
Information era Fighter upgrade.
Indonesian unique Medieval era naval unit that replaces the Frigate. Formation units all inherit escort's Movement speed and +5 Combat Strength when in a formation.
Hard-hitting, Medieval era heavy cavalry unit.
Roman unique Classical era melee unit that replaces the Swordsman. Can build a Roman Fort.

Gran Colombian Industrial era unique unit that replaces the Cavalry. Low maintenance cost. +2 Combat Strength for every adjacent Llanero. Fully heals when in range of a Comandante General that activates its retire ability.
Atomic era ranged unit.
Arabian unique Medieval era unit that replaces the Knight. Heals at the end of every turn, even after moving or attacking.
Egyptian unique Ancient era ranged unit that replaces the Heavy Chariot. 4 Movement when starting in open terrain.
Information era melee unit.
Industrial era support unit. Can heal adjacent units.
Medieval era support unit. Can construct Roads, Forts, Airstrip and Missile Silos improvements.
Brazilian unique Industrial era unit that replaces the Battleship. Stronger than the Battleship. Unlocked by Nationalism.
Strongest ranged naval unit, available in the Information era.
Information era anti-air support unit. Provides cover from air and nuclear attacks up to 1 tile away from the weapon.
Information era counter to cavalry class units.
Information era cavalry unit that is fast and strong.
Renaissance era melee unit.
A late-game civilian who can create a single National Park to attract tourists.
Kongo unique Classical era unit that replaces the Swordsman. +10 Combat Strength when defending against ranged attacks. Can move and see through Woods and Rainforest.

Highly advanced Information era ranged raiding naval unit that can be armed with nuclear weapons. Can only be seen by other Naval Raiders unless adjacent to it. Reveals Naval Raiders within sight range.
Modern era support unit. Adds +1 Range to adjacent bombard strength units.
Ethiopian unique Medieval era light cavalry unit. Stronger and greater sight than the Courser that it replaces. Receives no Movement penalty from moving in Hills.
American unique Modern era air unit that replaces the Fighter. Gains +5 attack against fighter aircraft, has +2 flight range, and gains +50% experience.
Medieval era melee unit that's strong against mounted units.
Renaissance era ranged naval unit with the ability to coastal raid. Can only be seen by other Naval Raiders unless adjacent to it. Reveals Naval Raiders within sight range.
Nubian unique Ancient era unit that replaces the Archer. Stronger than the Archer with extra Movement. Upgrades to Crossbowman.
Can only operate on Coastal waters until Cartography is researched.
Fast-moving Industrial era recon unit.
English unique Industrial era unit when Victoria is their leader. +10 Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other than that of your Capital 's. No disembark cost.
Information era bombard unit, ideal for attacking cities. Cannot move and attack on the same turn unless they've earned the Expert Crew promotion.
American unique Modern era unit when Teddy Roosevelt is their leader. Culture is earned from kills on their Capital 's continent. +10 Combat Strength when fighting on Hills. Lower maintenance cost.
Babylonian unique Ancient era melee unit. +17 Combat Strength against Heavy and Light Cavalry promotion class units. This unit has 3 Movement and sight.
Scythian unique Classical era unit. Ranged unit with 4 Movement with a Range of 1.
Japanese unique Medieval era melee unit. Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Fast-moving, Ancient era recon unit.
English unique Renaissance era naval unit that replaces the Privateer. Can capture enemy ships. Cannot be seen unless adjacent to it.
When adjacent to a city , attacking units ignore Walls and immediately assault the city.
Weak Ancient era ranged unit. Better on attack than defense.
Ancient era melee unit that's effective against mounted units.
Performs secret missions in foreign cities and protects your cities from enemy Spies.
Modern era ranged raiding naval unit. Can only be seen by other Naval Raiders unless adjacent to it. Reveals Naval Raiders within sight range.
Strong Classical era melee unit.
Basil II's unique Medieval era unit that replaces the Knight. Land units within 1 tile of the Tagma receive +4 Combat Strength or Religious Strength.
Fast-moving Modern era heavy cavalry unit that ignores zone of control.
May make and maintain a single Trade Route. Automatically creates Roads as it travels.
German unique Modern era naval unit that replaces the Submarine. Cheaper to produce, +1 Sight, and +10 Combat Strength when fighting on Ocean tiles. Able to reveal other stealthed units.
Indian unique Classical era unit that replaces the Horseman. Adjacent enemy units receive -5 Combat Strength.

Norwegian unique Ancient era naval unit that replaces the Galley. Can pillage enemy coastal lands and capture civilians if adjacent using its coastal raiding ability. 4 Movement while in coastal waters.
Sumerian unique Ancient era unit. Stronger than all other starting units. No penalties against anti-cavalry units. 4 Movement if this unit starts in open terrain.
Weak Ancient era melee unit.
Polish unique Medieval era unit. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.

nodes.Effects: +2 Amenities, +1 Great General point per turn, +1 Military policy slot, Provides the same defensive bonuses as the Fort improvement.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on Hills adjacent to an Encampment district.

nodes.Effects: +2 Faith, +1 Population in all current cities when built., +1 Housing in all cities.
nodes.Placement: Must be built adjacent to an Aqueduct district.

nodes.Effects: +2 Great Work slots, +2 Envoys when you build a wonder, including Apadana, in this city.
nodes.Placement: Must be built adjacent to a Capital.

nodes.Effects: +6 Gold, +3 Great Merchant points per turn, +1 Economic policy slot
nodes.Placement: Must be built next to a River adjacent to a Commercial Hub district with a Bank.

nodes.Effects: +1 Appeal to tiles adjacent to Rainforest and Marsh in your empire., Vanilla and R&F: When completed receive 100 Science for every Marsh, Rainforest, and Woods in this city.
nodes.Placement: Must be built next to a River adjacent to a Neighborhood.

nodes.Effects: +2 Great Writer points per turn., +2 Great Musician points per turn., +1 Great Work of Writing slot., +1 Great Work of Music slot., Awards 2 randomly-chosen free civics when completed.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on flat land adjacent to a Theater Square district.

nodes.Effects: +3 Great Writer points per turn., +3 Great Musician points per turn., +1 Great Work of Writing slot., +2 Great Work of Music slot., +20% Culture in that city, Gain a free random Atomic Era civic boost
nodes.Placement: Must be built on flat land next to a Theater Square district.

nodes.Effects: +2 Culture and +1 Production to all Rainforest tiles for this city
nodes.Placement: Must be built on Rainforest.

nodes.Effects: +2 Culture and +3 Amenities to this city and all cities within 6 tiles, +2 Culture, +2 Amenities and +2 Loyalty to each City Center within 6 tiles
nodes.Placement: Must be built on flat land adjacent to an Entertainment Complex district.

nodes.Effects: +3 Gold, +1 Great Admiral point per turn, +1 Trade Route capacity, Grants a Trader unit.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on Coast and adjacent to a Harbor district.

nodes.Effects: +4 Culture, Tourism output from Relics and Holy Cities is not diminished by other civilizations who have researched The Enlightenment civic., Doubles Tourism output of Seaside Resorts across your civilization.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on Hills.

nodes.Effects: All tiles in your civilization gain +2 Appeal
nodes.Placement: Must be built on flat land adjacent to City Center.

nodes.Effects: +6 Culture in each city of your civilization, +2 Amenities in each city of your civilization
nodes.Placement: Must be built on flat land adjacent to an Entertainment Complex with a Stadium.

nodes.Effects: +5 Culture, +1 Wildcard policy slot
nodes.Placement: Must be built on flat land adjacent to City Center.

nodes.Effects: +2 Science, +1 Great Scientist point per turn, +2 Great Works of Writing slots, Receives boost to all Ancient and Classical era technologies., +1 Great Writer point per turn, Receive a random tech boost after another player recruits a Great Scientist.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on flat land adjacent to a Campus with a Library.

nodes.Effects: +3 Gold, +1 Great Admiral point per turn, +1 Movement for all naval units.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on the Coast and adjacent to a Harbor district with a Lighthouse.

nodes.Effects: +5 Gold, +2 Great Merchant points per turn., +1 Trade Route capacity. Your Trade Routes from this city get +2 Gold for every Bonus resource in this city's territory.
nodes.Placement: Must be built adjacent to Cattle and a Commercial Hub district with a Market.

nodes.Effects: +4 Faith, Missionaries and Apostles can spread religion 1 extra time.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on flat land adjacent to a Holy Site district, and player must have founded a religion.

nodes.Effects: Increases Growth by 15% in all cities., +2 Housing
nodes.Placement: Must be built next to a River.

nodes.Effects: +3 Great Artist points per turn, +4 Great Works of Art slots
nodes.Placement: Must be built next to a River on a non-Desert and non-Tundra tile.

nodes.Effects: +1 Amenity from Entertainment for each adjacent lake tile. +1 Food and +1 Production for each Lake tile in your empire
nodes.Placement: Must be built on a Lake tile adjacent to land.

nodes.Effects: Awards 2 Iron., Provides +4 Faith to your cities that are within 6 tiles.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on a Desert Hills tile.

nodes.Effects: +4 Faith, Grant 2 Apostles
nodes.Placement: Must be built on Woods adjacent to a Holy Site district with a Temple, and player must have founded a religion.

nodes.Effects: +1 Science, +1 Faith, and +1 Culture on all Coast tiles in this city., All Great Engineers have an additional charge.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on a coastal tile adjacent to a Harbor district.

nodes.Effects: +2 Faith, +2 Relic slots, All Apostles you create gain the Martyr ability in addition to a second ability you choose normally.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on Floodplains or Marsh.

nodes.Effects: +1 Culture, +1 Faith, Patronage of Great People costs 25% less Faith., Districts in this city provide +2 Great Person points of their type.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on Hills.

nodes.Effects: +3 Great Scientist points per turn, +2 Great Works of Writing slots, +20% Science in city, and awards 2 randomly chosen free technologies when completed.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on flat Grasslands or Plains adjacent to a Campus district with a University.

nodes.Effects: +2 Food, +2 Gold, and +1 Production on all Desert tiles for this city (non-Floodplains)
nodes.Placement: Must be built on Desert or Floodplains without Hills.

nodes.Effects: +2 Culture, +3 Faith, +1 Diplomatic policy slot
nodes.Placement: Must be built on a Hill adjacent to a Mountain.

nodes.Effects: +2 Culture, Grants a free Builder., All Builders can build one extra improvement.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on Desert (including Floodplains) without Hills.

nodes.Effects: +20% Production in this city, and +1 Production for each Mine and Quarry in this city.
nodes.Placement: Must be built along a River adjacent to an Industrial Zone district with a Factory.

nodes.Effects: +3 Gold, Grants 3 Spearmen, 3 Archers, and a Battering Ram., +50% Production towards anti-cavalry units across your civilization.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on flat land adjacent to an Encampment with a Barracks.

nodes.Effects: +2 Faith, Grants a free Great Prophet., Great Prophets may found a religion on Stonehenge instead of a Holy Site.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on flat land adjacent to Stone.

nodes.Effects: +8 Culture, +5 Great Musician points per turn, +3 Great Works of Music slots
nodes.Placement: Must be built on Coast adjacent to a Harbor. Cannot be built on a Lake.

nodes.Effects: +2 Great General points per turn, All current land units gain a Promotion level., All Archaeologists from the owner may enter foreign lands without Open Borders.
nodes.Placement: Must be built on flat Grassland or Plains adjacent to an Encampment district with a Barracks or Stable.

nodes.Effects: +2 Great Engineer points per turn, Receive a second naval unit each time you train a naval unit.[6]
nodes.Placement: Must be built on the Coast and adjacent to an Industrial Zone district.
